divs: sighting detailsmarch 6, 2010 - around 4 am or so, i was tired, yet wide awake for some reason. i couldn't sleep that night and was trying to meditate inorder to relax, and i was finally really relaxing. then i heard an air force jet outside. the sound kept on for a while, so i opened my patio door, looked up and saw what looked like several individually hovering bright white lights, and a only few red lights. most were hovering at various somewhat high altitudes just north east of the flatirons mountain range, generally spanning over areas of central boulder. they were star-like, but not stars - too low & too large to be stars, and slightly moving\hovering... and softly pulsing, not sharply, steadily flashing\blinking as planes do. the air force jet kept circling round and round for quite a while, just under and through the area of the cluster of lights. (the air force jet seemed as if to discourage them from hovering any lower?) some of the lights seemed to appear and disappear randomly. one red light(orb) was constant and much lower and closer to me, appearing larger. it was glowing bright reddish\orange toward the center. there's a strange\interesting intuitive aspect to my experience as well. i felt there was some kind of connection\communication through telepathy... very difficult to explain. i was in a state of shock and amazement, i guess you could say. i didn't think to grab a camera. i didn't even watch to see how long they were all out there. i didn't feel afraid, but it did take a while to process the experience. it was very positive actually, and deeply profound. it gave me lots to think about. they looked just like other star-like\orb\lights i've now seen on youtube from sightings all over the world. wow... there really is something to this whole "ufo" thing. definitely worth investigating further... much to learn with all of this.
trends: There have been 185 other sightings in Denver
There were no other sightings in Denver on or around March 6th 2010
Summary: Large cluster of white and a few reddish/orange lights, Air Force jet circling
